intro: Inula gnaphalodes, commonly known as the slender elecampane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets. Inula gnaphalodes is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
